comments.author: pBakhuis@Gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.8) Gecko/20100727 Firefox/3.6.8 (Palemoon/3.6.8)
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.8) Gecko/20100727 Firefox/3.6.8 (Palemoon/3.6.8)

I have a very large list with downloads (several hundreds) in the download dialog (ctrl+j) so I decided to clear out the last two-hundred or so. 
I did this by selecting the last ~two-hundred entries and rightclicking / selecting "Remove from list". 

This resulted in the entire browser going into an unresponsive state, both the Download dialog and the main window were locked until the selected entries were removed from the list. 

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Downloads lots of stuff to fill up the download list.
2. Clear part of the list. (The Clear List button seems to work instantly?)
Actual Results:  
Browser goes unresponsive for the duration of the 'remove' operation.

Expected Results:  
At least the main window should stay responsive by running the remove task in separate thread? Better would be to have the download dialog itself remain to be responsive as well but showing some sort of 'removing selected download entries' indication.

comments.author: mak@mozilla.com
comments.text: Is that really on Firefox 3.6 or did you override the user agent?
